title: Substitution
text: Since the first equation already expresses $$y$$ in terms of $$x$$, substitute the first equation into the second equation for an equation only in terms of $$x$$.

title: Substituted Expression
text: What is the resulting expression in terms of only $$x$$ after simplifying?

title: Solve for $$x$$
text: To solve for the value(s) of $$x$$, isolate the variable from the equation. Note the positive and negative answers resulting from taking a square root.

title: Values of $$y$$
text: To solve for the two values of $$y$$, substitute each of the $$x$$ values into the first equation of $$y=x$$. The value of $$x$$ and $$y$$ should be equal.

title: Larger x-coordinate
text: Out of the two possible solution points, choose the point with the larger positive coordinate for $$x$$.
